sen.j: 三好 義興（みよし よしおき）は、戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Yoshioki MIYOSHI was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku Period (Japan.)
Yoshioki MIYOSHI was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku Period (Japan).
Yoshioki MIYOSHI was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
sen.cmt: 戦国時代→the Sengoku period (period of warring states)に訂正しました。

sen.e: He was Nagayoshi MIYOSHI's progeny.
He was Nagayoshi MIYOSHI's son.
He was Nagayoshi MIYOSHI's son.

sen.j: 天文 (元号)11年（1542年）、三好長慶の嫡男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in 1542 as a progeny of Nagayoshi MIYOSHI.
He was born in 1542 as the son of Nagayoshi MIYOSHI.
He was born in 1542 as the son of Nagayoshi MIYOSHI.

sen.j: 早くから父に世子として指名され、永禄3年（1560年）には従四位筑前国に叙位・任官され、室町幕府第13代将軍・足利義輝から「義」の字を賜って義長と名乗り、御供衆・相伴衆に任じられる。
sen.e: Yoshioki, who had been determined to be a successor by his father when he was still young, was promoted to Jushi rank (senior fourth rank) Chikuzen-no-kuni in 1560, and appointed as Otomoshu and Shobanshu, while he was permitted by the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) the 13th shogun Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA to use a letter "義" from his name, 足利義輝 and identifying himself as Yoshinaga, 義長.

Yoshioki, who had been determined to be a successor by his father when he was still young, was promoted to the rank of Jushi (senior fourth rank) Chikuzen-no-kuni in 1560. He was also appointed as Otomoshu and Shobanshu, and permitted by the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) of the 13th shogun Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA to use the character "義" from his name, 足利義輝 and identified himself as Yoshinaga, 義長.

Yoshioki, who had been determined to be a successor by his father when he was still young, was promoted to the rank of Jushii (Junior Fourth Rank) in Chikuzen Province in 1560, also appointed as Otomoshu and Shobanshu and permitted by the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) of the 13th shogun Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA to use the character '義' from his name, '足利義輝' and identified himself as '義長' (Yoshinaga).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の原則に従って訂正しました。従四位→Jushii (Junior Fourth Rank)に訂正しました。筑前国→in Chikuzen Provinceとしました。原文の「」に従って、' 'に訂正しました。

sen.j: 同年、父が河内国飯盛山城に移ると、摂津国の芥川山城を任されている。
sen.e: His father moved to Kawachi-no-kuni Imoriyama Castle in the same year, and he was assigned to take care of Akutagawa-yama Castle in Settsu-no-kuni.
His father moved to Kawachi-no-kuni Imoriyama Castle in the same year, and he was assigned to take care of Akutagawa-yama Castle in Settsu-no-kuni.
His father moved to Kawachi Province, Imoriyama Castle in the same year, and he was assigned to take care of Akutagawa-yama Castle in Settsu Province.

sen.j: 父に劣らず智勇に秀で、六角義賢が京都に侵攻して来た時も松永久秀と協力してこれを撃退し、永禄5年（1562年）には河内国飯盛山城の戦いで勇猛で鳴る畠山高政の軍勢に大勝するなど、若い頃からその有能さを天下に示していた。
sen.e: He was great about wisdom and a martial art like his father and his competence was known far and wide when he was still young; he could fight back Yoshikata ROKKAKU who invaded Kyoto in cooperation with Hidehisa MATSUNAGA and also in 1562, won a great victory in the Battle of Imoriyama Castle against Takamasa HATAKEYAMA's troops which were well known for braveness and valor.

He was both wise and adept at the martial arts, much like his father, and his competence was known far and wide while he was still young. Allied with Hidehisa MATSUNAGA he fought back Yoshikata ROKKAKU, who invaded Kyoto. He also won a great victory in the Battle of Imoriyama Castle in 1562 against Takamasa HATAKEYAMA's troops, which were reknowned for their braveness and valor.

He was both wise and adept at the martial arts, much like his father, and his competence was known far and wide while he was still young, allied with Hidehisa MATSUNAGA he fought back Yoshikata ROKKAKU, who invaded Kyoto, also he won a great victory in the Battle of Imoriyama Castle in 1562 against Takamasa HATAKEYAMA's troops, which were reknowned for their braveness and valor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の原則に従って訂正しました。

sen.j: また、義興は豊かな教養人でもあり、将軍・足利義輝や公家たちからの信望も厚かった。
sen.e: He was also such a highly educated person that he could enjoy prestige from Shogun Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA and Kuge (nobles.)
sen.cmt: 公家に（nobles）を追加しました。
sen.e: He was also a highly educated person who enjoyed prestige from the Shogun Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA and Kuge (nobles).
He was also a highly educated person who enjoyed prestige from the Shogun Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA and Kuge (nobles).

sen.j: しかし永禄6年（1563年）8月、突如として居城芥川山城において急死した。
sen.e: In August 1563, he died suddenly in his residence, Akutagawa-yama Castle.
In August 1563, he died suddenly in his residence, Akutagawa-yama Castle.
He was twenty two years old.
He was twenty two years old.
He was twenty two years old.

sen.j: これには主家征服を目論む松永久秀の毒殺説の疑いが強いが、真偽は定かではない。
sen.e: It has been strongly suspected that he may be killed with poison by Hidehisa MATSUNAGA who was attempting to take over the Shuke (a building where the master/lord lives), but it remains unconvinced.
sen.cmt: 下のようにしました。主家→Shuke (a building where the master/lord lives)
sen.e: It is strongly suspected that he may have been poisoned by Hidehisa MATSUNAGA, who was attempting to take over the Shuke (a building where the master/lord lives), but this issue remains unresolved.
It is strongly suspected that he may have been poisoned by Hidehisa MATSUNAGA, who was attempting to take over the lord, but this issue remains unresolved.
sen.cmt: 主家→lordと解釈し、訂正しました。

sen.j: また、父の長慶は義興の死で心身に異常をきたし、翌年に後を追うように病没している。
sen.e: His father Nagayoshi got to suffer from mental and physical disorders due to the death of Yoshioki and died of disease in the following year as if he would have followed his son.
His father, Nagayoshi, suffered from mental and physical disorders due to the death of Yoshioki. He died of disease in the following year as if he was following his son.
His father, Nagayoshi, suffered from mental and physical disorders due to the death of Yoshioki, and he died of disease in the following year as if he was following his son.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の原則に従って訂正しました。
